Class INDIBLOBElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.client.INDIElement
      • laazotea.indi.client.INDIBLOBElement

  • public class INDIBLOBElement
extends INDIElement
    A class representing a INDI BLOB Element.
    Version:
    1.32, February 4, 2012
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

        property - The INDIProperty to which the Element belongs.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(org.w3c.dom.Element xml)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the current value of this BLOB Element. It is assummed that the XML Element is really describing the new value for this particular BLOB Element.

        This method will notify the change of the value to the listeners.

        Specified by:
        setValue in class INDIElement
        Parameters:
        xml - A XML Element <oneBLOB> describing the Element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the xml is not well formed (no size, no format or incorrectly coded data

      • getDefaultUIComponent

        public INDIElementListener getDefaultUIComponent()
                                          throws laazotea.indi.INDIException
        Description copied from class: INDIElement
        Gets a default UI component to handle the repesentation and control of this Element. The panel is registered as a listener of this Element. Please note that the UI class must implement INDIElementListener. The component will be chosen depending on the loaded UI libraries (I4JClientUI, I4JAndroid, etc). Note that a casting of the returned value must be done. If a previous UI element has been asked, it will be discarded and de-registered as listener. So, only one default UI element will be active.
        Specified by:
        getDefaultUIComponent in class INDIElement
        Returns:
        A UI component that handles this Element.
        Throws:
        laazotea.indi.INDIException

      • checkCorrectValue

        public boolean checkCorrectValue(java.lang.Object desiredValue)
                          throws INDIValueException
        Checks if a desired value would be correct to be applied to the BLOB Element.
        Specified by:
        checkCorrectValue in class INDIElement
        Parameters:
        desiredValue - The value to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the desiredValue is a INDIBLOBValue. false otherwise
        Throws:
        INDIValueException - if desiredValue is null.
